title: Graph magnetic force on wire as function voltage

content.description:
The following questions are related to this scenario:

Two long, straight, parallel wires are held fixed, as shown above. A voltage is applied to wire X, creating a current IX to the right, and the wire experiences a magnetic force of magnitude FB toward wire Y.
content.question: Assuming the resistance of wire X is constant, which of the following graphs correctly illustrates the magnitude of the magnetic force F on wire X as a function of the voltage V applied to the wire?

choices.label: Choice A is a graph in the first quadrant with F on the vertical axis and V on the horizontal axis. Choice A shows a curve that is decreasing and concave up everywhere, appearing to make an asymptote with the vertical axis on the left and with the horizontal axis on the right.
Choice B is a graph in the first quadrant with F on the vertical axis and V on the horizontal axis. Choice B is a horizontal line above the horizontal axis.
Choice C is a graph in the first quadrant with F on the vertical axis and V on the horizontal axis. Choice C shows a curve that starts at the origin and is increasing and concave up.
Choice D is a graph in the first quadrant with F on the vertical axis and V on the horizontal axis. Choice D shows a linearly increasing line starting at the origin.
Choice E is a graph in the first quadrant with F on the vertical axis and V on the horizontal axis. Choice E shows a curve that starts at the origin and is increasing and concave down.

content.answer: Choice D is a graph in the first quadrant with F on the vertical axis and V on the horizontal axis. Choice D shows a linearly increasing line starting at the origin.
